bug.short_desc: Comic book volume numbers have a maximum of 9999 not 1000000

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: Sometime ago DC released a bunch of 1,000,0000 issues. These cannot be entered into gcstar at the moment. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a comic collection 2. Add a comic 3. Fetch information for Supergirl (1996) 4. Add issue 1000000. Actual results: Comic added with volume set to 1000000 Expected results: Comic added with volume set to 9999 Additional info: Modify /usr/share/gcstar/lib/GCModels/GCcomics.gcm. This should be reported upstream but I haven't been able to create a forum account and have found no way to notify upstream.

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug. If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug. Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
It can still be reproduced in Fedora 24.
Tian, unless you disagree strongly, I'll patch the package to support this.
gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2290234471
gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e656c47c9c

gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e656c47c9c

gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2290234471
gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gcstar-1.7.1-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
Given that this incident made me look for my login and password on the GCstar forums, I've submitted Dennis' request as a bug report: http://forums.gcstar.org/viewtopic.php?pid=28520
